Package controller

Class ModifyProduct

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.ModifyProduct
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class ModifyProduct
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class controls the application window for the ModifyProduct screen.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        The initialize method sets up the ModifyProduct screen on launch.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • onModifyProductAddButton

        public void onModifyProductAddButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onModifyProductAddButton is called when the user clicks the add button on the ModifyProduct screen. This method adds the selected part to the modifyProductAssocPartsTable.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the ModifyProduct screen

      • onModifyProductRemoveButton

        public void onModifyProductRemoveButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onModifyProductRemoveButton is called when the user clicks the remove associated parts button on the ModifyProduct screen. This method removes the selected part from the modifyProductAssocPartsTable.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the ModifyProduct screen

      • onModifyProductSaveButton

        public void onModifyProductSaveButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        The onModifyProductSaveButton method is called when the user clicks the Save button on the ModifyProduct screen. This method gets the user text inputs and the associated parts list and creates an instance of the Product class. It replaces that instance with the modified instance in the allProducts list in the Inventory class. Alerts are in place to catch errors.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the ModifyProduct screen
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onModifyProductCancelButton

        public void onModifyProductCancelButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        The onModifyProductCancelButton method is called when the user clicks the Cancel button on the ModifyProduct screen. This method ensures the user wants to cancel, then launches the MainScreen screen of the application.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the ModifyProduct screen
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onModifyProductSearch

        public void onModifyProductSearch​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onModifyProductSearch is called when the user presses enter while the cursor is in the search window on the ModifyProduct screen. This method calls the lookupPart method from Inventory and searches for the part based on the user input. Then it places the parts in the tableview.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the enter press on the user keyboard

      • findProductIndex

        private int findProductIndex​(Product product)
        The findProductIndex method finds the index of the product to be modified in the allProducts list in Inventory. This method checks the allProducts list from Inventory and returns the index for the product.
        Parameters:
        product - the product to search for
        Returns:
        the index for the part in the allParts list in Inventory
